runs.comm: back of a length, pushed across Roy who leaves it alone...doubt we'll see many of them
similar line and length, this time Roy cuts it behind point and wide of third man to get off the mark
some swing there, but started on the wrong line and slipped down the leg side
now that's flung very wide outside off, almost misses the cut strip
gets back around off stump, but that's a lovely piece of timing by Roy as he pushes forward and places it square through the covers...Warner chases it down well with a flick back just before the rope
full outside off, 89mph, through to the keeper
another one down the leg side, Starc's radar isn't in sync yet. Long over to start with
spears into the pads, a strangled appeal for lbw but that pitched outside leg stump...did Roy a little for pace, though
a wild swing and a miss to a length ball outside off...a lengthy, wayward over so costing seven isn't too bad a result for Australia
on a length, angled into the pads, tucked out to deep square leg
short delivery, around middle and off, but not a full on bouncer...Roy is through his pull shot early and takes it in the stomach
uses his feet then swings through the line of a full delivery, skews off a thick outside edge and carries towards third man but lands in front of the fielder
full at off stump, 86mph, defended to the leg side
works with the angle coming into him, flicked into square leg
well bowled, a length ball nipping into him which he drops towards mid-on for a quick single
heaves a length delivery into the leg side but picks out the man in front of square
fuller this time, at the stumps, 90mph, driven into the leg side
full outside off, Roy was giving himself some room to leg so had to stretch for the delivery and couldn't make contact
lovely stroke, a whip-pull by Roy as Starc drops short...placement was the key as he slotted it wide of the man at deep square
back to a full length and it's forced with a straight bat through midwicket but a strong throw from Stoinis keeps them to a single
full at middle and off, 90mph, drop and run into the off side...a smart way to score off the good balls
appeal for lbw, a full ball spearing into the pads but that appeared to he shading down the leg side as Hales misses his whip to the leg side
another big appeal! A full toss this time. Michael Gough shakes his head again. That looked a bit closer. Replays show it was missing leg.
well, that's done it! 91mph, Hales done for pace. Another low full toss, Hales is late on the stroke, gets an inside edge onto the pads then into the stumps
yorker-length outside off, 93mph, that's some heat, and Moeen jabs it down to third man off the toe of the bat
confident drive from Roy as he strides forward to a full ball on off stump but picks out cover

and another! Two in the over for Cummins. Roy tries to launch a length delivery over the off side, but gets more elevation that distance...still, took a very good catch by Coulter-Nile as he back-tracked from mid-off
short of a length outside off, Morgan holds his bat inside the line and it goes through to Wade
fuller at middle and off, 88mph, pushed firmly back down the pitch
hint of width, cut in the air through the vacant gully area to third man
a bouncer over leg stump, Moeen pulls out of an aggressive stroke
that's a gorgeous piece of timing, punches a back-of-a-length delivery wide of mid-off but it's heading towards one of the long corners on the ground
done for pace by a ball which slides across outside off
plays over the top of a full delivery outside off...91mph
good length at off stump, 91mph, pushed firmly to mid-off
fuller this time, another drive again finds mid-off
direct hit! But Moeen's makes it with a dive. He picked out mid-off, again, with a drive but this time opted to sprint off for the run
excellent pressure being built as Morgan drives a full delivery to mid-off
finds the gap this time, drives through the line and this time opens the face a fraction to place it wide of cover...that whistled off the bat
now Moeen goes over the off side, a flowing drive which he places wide of the point sweeper
drags the length back, pushed into the backward-point area
tight on middle and off, slower at 75mph, pushed into the off side
comes down the pitch then gets beaten on the under edge as he tries to play through the off side...ball travels over the stumps
short ball at the body, Morgan swivels on a pull which goes very fine to one of the shorter, straight boundaries
back of a length outside off, a cutter, chopped down to third man
round the wicket, touch short but Morgan cracks it straight to cover
slides on, Morgan exposes his stumps as he moves to the leg side but is able to cut to deep point
flicked through midwicket
fuller at the stumps, driven down to long-off
fired in at the pads, Moeen goes for a sweep but doesn't make contact and the ball bobbles to short fine leg

drops short this time, Moeen latches on with a pull in front of square...Starc at deep square makes a good diving save, but then makes a bit of a best of trying to get the ball back. The batsmen take a third, and then Morgan has to dive to make his ground
on a length at off stump, 74mph, pushed into the off side
that's a mighty blow! Dragged down short, Moeen is already coming down the pitch and then he pulls it handsomely over deep square leg
short again, around off stump, sits up nicely and Moeen dismissively bludgeons him through straight midwicket
gets this a little fuller, driven down to long-off
another short ball, Morgan's pull is not as convincing as Moeen's earlier in the over, takes a top edge, but lands short of deep square
fuller outside off, driven square out to deep point
flicked from around off stump down to long-on
uses his feet, Maxwell drags the length back and Morgan can only nudge into the leg side...thought of a second for a moment as Wade chases it
sweeps a straight delivery to short fine leg
follows Morgan as he moves to the leg side, the pull comes from high on the bat and lobs down towards long-on
width outside off, cut to deep cover
ends up cutting this delivery from well outside leg as he had moved so far to the on side, picks out deep cover
he sounds the bugle, comes down the pitch and clubs a length delivery over mid-on...not clearly timed, off the bottom of the bat, but easily cleared mid-on
ah, that's sweet! Gee, that made a good sound. Drills through the line of a fuller delivery and sends it perfectly straight down the ground
a lot of slower balls from Marsh, this one nudged into the leg side
a slower bouncer now, outside off at 72mph, Moeen is through his pull far too early
back of a length at off stump, driven from the back foot into the covers
another slower short ball, Moeen is defeated again as he tries to swing through the leg side...Marsh recovered well after those boundaries
short of a length, cramps Morgan for room as he aims to play to the off side
a slower ball down the leg side, paddled out to deep square
pulls a short ball, comes off the splice but falls into space over midwicket and long-on runs around
fuller on middle and leg and that's sweetly picked up over the leg side, didn't try to hit that one too hard
gets right across his stumps this time, it's a fuller ball and his wrists come into play as he flicks it wide of short fine-leg. Hands on head for the bowler
outside off, clubbed back to the bowler
full outside off, skewed over point as Morgan tries clear the off side...the bat face turned in his hand

what a shot! Astonishing power from Morgan, albeit to the shorter boundary, as he comes down the pitch. Watson saw him, dropped it shorter but Morgan was still able to muscle it over long-off with a cross-batted swing
driven in the air but short of cover
shuffles across his crease, Watson pushes it outside off and Morgan is beaten
full at the stumps, driven down the ground
drives a full ball very firmly through the off side, stayed on leg stump so he could free his arms, all along the ground wide of the sweeper
drags the first one down a little outside off, pulled to long-on
he targets the short boundary, basically just slugs a length delivery straight down the ground
short again, and this time it's pulled with power and placement wide of deep midwicket. Lovely quick footwork and quick hands. Superb fifty off 31 balls
that's bigger! Uses his feet and picks up a delivery around leg stump with a free swing of the arms over deep midwicket. Effortless.
a quicker ball, fired it around leg stump, pushed down the ground
full outside off, chopped into the ground off a bottom edge and bobbles to point
six more! The charge is well and truly on. Another supreme strike by Morgan as he drives a full delivery well over long on
low full toss outside off, driven sweetly through the off side and the sweeper can't stop the second
gets a leading edge as he aims to work a delivery off his pads but it loops short of Smith running in from cover
into the crowd again! Terrific way to go to fifty off 32 balls...hoicks a short ball over deep square leg even though he was cramped for a little room
brilliant strike, hammers through the line of a full ball as Watson tries to mix up his length but it just goes straight back over his head
the pressure tells, fired miles outside off stump
full at the stumps, gets underneath it and chips just short of long-on...22 off the over
low full toss outside off, driven in the air but lands short of deep cover
full at leg stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
gets a yorker in which is squeezed to the covers
another full toss, Moeen gives himself room to the leg side and drives through point...Warner's speed across the ground keeps them to one
these straight boundaries are very short...Morgan manages to larrup a big full toss off somewhere near the bottom of the bat and it lands in the crowd
that's one of the longer boundaries...and it's six again. Cummins drops it short and Morgan pulls emphatically over deep midwicket
he goes straight down the ground, too, but clothed a little by Moeen
gets underneath this, goes miles into the Cardiff sky and does not quite have the distance this time as Watson settles under it just inside the rope at long on
that's sharp, a short ball at leg stump which beats Moeen over the top edge
fuller this time, heaved through midwicket and places it between two of the deep men
short of a length, Moeen moves to the leg side and pulls over midwicket...doesn't quite fine the middle
back of a length, straight, tucked into the leg side...good over from NCL and a good spell
superb placement from Buttler as he lofts a full ball over extra cover, just opened the blade to find the gap
and now he clears wide long-on...another full delivery and Buttler switches sides, launching it over the in-field and that didn't even find the middle
a wide full toss outside off
finds mid-on...clubs a length delivery and doesn't get elevation or placement. A brief, lively stay for Buttler. Next!
round the wicket, full outside off, 90mph, driven straight to cover
well bowled, beaten outside off by a full ball at 91mph
a fresh air swing from Billings as he charges down the pitch...so he soaks up three dot balls
full outside off, cracked over the off side to deep cover
charges down the pitch, beaten for pace by a very sharp delivery above 90mph, goes for a pull which skews into the off side
connects sweetly with a drive but it goes straight to cover...some valuable dot balls for Australia
somehow gets this down to third man, goes right across the crease outside off and aims to work to the leg side then the ball takes the pad...a better throw and he would have been struggling
full at the stumps, 91mph, driven firmly to deep cover
done for pace again, nudging 94mph, rattles into the top of his leg as he tries to pull and the leg bye means it keeps the strike which Australia won't mind
round the wicket, full outside leg, Billings gets a leading edge out to deep cover
over the wicket, and elegantly sliced away over backward point, it was a full delivery and he allowed the ball to slide off an open face
low full toss, this time he drives out to deep cover so loses the strike
a straight, low full toss is driven straight to mid-off...Smith's throw is on target, Starc takes the bails off. Billings struggled today
well bowled, yorker outside off, Moeen can only heave into the leg side
one ball for Stokes, it's a low full toss which he crunches straight to mid-off who is inside the circle
